part2.question:
Describe a person who apologized to you. You should say:
Who the person was
When it was
Why this person apologized
And explain how you felt about it.
part2.model_answer: I'd like to describe my good friend, Tom, who apologized to me last week. He apologized because he had accidentally revealed a secret I told him in confidence to others. He seemed very Regretful [后悔的] and Sincere [真诚的] when he came to me to admit his fault. I felt relieved that he was Honest [诚实的] enough to admit his mistake and Clear the air [消除误会] instead of hiding it from me. It was Courageous [勇敢的] of him to Swallow his pride and say sorry directly to my face. I valued his friendship more than the mistake, so I forgave him immediately without hesitation.

part2.question:
Describe a time when you told your friend an important truth. You should say:
Who your friend is
What the truth was
What your friend's reaction was
And explain why you think it was important to be honest.
part2.model_answer: I told my friend Sarah that her new haircut didn't suit her very well at all. It was an Awkward [尴尬的] conversation because I didn't want to hurt her feelings. However, she asked for my Honest [诚实的] opinion, so I decided to tell her the absolute truth. Her reaction was surprisingly positive; she appreciated my candor and trusted me more for it. I think it was important to be honest [诚实的] because true friendship relies on trust. I needed to Get something off my chest rather than let her go out looking bad. It strengthened our bond in the end.

part2.question:
Describe a person you admire for their honesty. You should say:
Who this person is
How they showed their honesty
What the result of their honesty was
And explain why you respect them.
part2.model_answer: I admire my grandfather for his unwavering honesty and Integrity [正直] throughout his life. He once found a wallet full of cash on the street and immediately turned it into the police station. The result was that the owner, a poor student, got his money back and was extremely grateful. I respect him because he showed true Integrity [正直] even when no one was watching him do it. He taught me that being Forgiving [宽容的] and honest [诚实的] makes you a better person and earns respect from everyone around you. His example has guided me in my own life choices many times.

part3.question: In what situations should we apologize immediately?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] We should apologize immediately when we accidentally hurt someone or break trust. [Reason] A quick apology shows that you value the relationship and take responsibility for your actions. [Example] If you step on someone's foot or bump into them, you say sorry instantly. [Extension] It is basic social Etiquette [礼节] and demonstrates good character and Morality [道德].

part3.question: Do you think accepting apologies is always the correct thing to do?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Generally, yes, forgiveness helps resolve Conflict [冲突] peacefully and restores harmony in relationships. [Reason] Holding a grudge only hurts yourself in the long run and damages relationships unnecessarily. [Example] Choosing to Bury the hatchet [言归于好] allows everyone to move forward positively. [Extension] However, trust may take a long time to rebuild fully after a serious betrayal.

part3.question: Do you agree that sometimes people should tell lies (white lies)?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Yes, sometimes a small White lie [善意的谎言] is necessary to be polite and kind. [Reason] Total honesty can be brutal and unnecessary in sensitive social situations. [Example] Telling someone they look nice when they are tired is a kind gesture. [Extension] It protects feelings without causing real harm or malicious Deception [欺骗]. Social harmony often depends on these small, harmless untruths.

part3.question: Do you think we should tell the truth at all times?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] While Honesty is the best policy [诚实是上策] usually, there are definitely exceptions in real life. [Reason] As mentioned, kindness sometimes outweighs strict truth-telling to prevent hurt feelings unnecessarily. [Example] We shouldn't reveal secrets that aren't ours to tell to others ever. [Extension] Finding the balance between truth and compassion is key to good relationships.

part3.question: Is "honesty" still valued as a primary virtue in modern business?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Yes, Integrity [正直] is crucial for long-term business success and reputation globally. [Reason] Customers and partners need to trust the company they deal with implicitly. [Example] A company caught in a scandal loses money and trust very fast. [Extension] Deception [欺骗] might work briefly, but honesty is the foundation of commerce and Morality [道德] in the market.

part3.question: How does a culture of forgiveness contribute to social harmony?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Forgiveness promotes healing and reduces the destructive cycle of revenge in society. [Reason] When a Community [社区] values Resolution [解决] over punishment, it becomes more peaceful. [Example] South Africa's Truth and Reconciliation Commission is a famous historical example. [Extension] It allows society to move past historical trauma and build a future together in peace for the benefit of all citizens.
